caption: Been here so many time. Very tourist area, good to borrowing, lots of area, expensive and so so good honestly.  I would want to come here just once but it‚Äôs a main intersection to go from place to place. Also you can get warm here.  Worth the walk but not worth to come twice.

A lovely passage second on our list, this is very popular with tourist, seems to be on the big group trail, however, still worth a visit taking in all the lovely stalls, the hotel Chopin is within its walls, for that full immersion experience.

What a beautiful place! I found many stamps collection and some well maintained paper pieces from old books and newspapers for many places around the world. A unique experience to walk through this passage in Paris. It‚Äôs also great that you exit one passage and exactly cross the street you find the next one and so on.
Not a big place, but beautiful and quiet. It includes a number of shops, restaurants and cafes
An interesting historical shopping area with some unique shops.

Very elegant passage with strong nostalgic vibe. You will be surprised to see lots of interesting and historical shops here, including the famous Grevin Museum. Walking here makes you feel like going back to the Belle Epoque 100 years ago. Please don‚Äôt miss this place when visiting Paris!

This place is a great pitspot üöè on your next trip to Paris! üá´üá∑ Passage Jouffroy is filled with beautiful ü§© stores üè™, restaurants üç¥, gift üéÅ shops, cafes ‚òï, and more! It so fun to walk üö∂‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è around the passage and explore! üîç I wish I knew about this place earlier!

A very interesting passageway of almost 200 years. You can see a lot of interesting shops from antiques, specialized toys and decoration and restaurants. Souvenir shops are also nice here and the plus is that it is open on sundays.
Worth the visit. Numerous restaurants, cafes, patisseries, and unique shops. The covered passages go for a number of blocks. It was a little break from the heat of the streets in August.
A place of where you can see the past and present of Paris ! :) & There are many unique and sophisticated objects.  ... Parisian ...‚ô° I took a lot of pictures without even realizing it! ^^

Very old and nostalgic passage in Paris. You can find some antique shops and many cafes here. Don‚Äôt forget to visit the old bookstore üìúat the end of the passage with some unique old books. There are also some precious stones store üíéhere.
Interesting place with a range of shops selling stuff. Worth a look given the history and this was opened in 1847.
There are all kinds of restaurants to choose from. Also a great view of the inverted glass pyramid at the museum.
Pretty but nothing to do other than look at overpriced tat - if you‚Äôre in the area stop by but don‚Äôt make it a destination or go to place
Unexpected surprise,  another walkway also covered with a  glass roof  was across the street. One side was mostly restaurants and one side was mostly shops
This is my favorite of all parisien passages. There are some retro, some chic and some elegance. It was really fun discovering this passage.
Cute passage and the stores are fun: antique and modern toy stores, Christmas decorations stores, poster and photography stores etc.
Nice attractive place . So many shops inside . Showing architectural ability of france. Highly recomended for visit.
This is the one with the cool unique shopping, including a christmas store.
Better than other nearby passages (which are closed or half derelict) but not worth a special visit.
Great place to discover unique shops and browse around.

Beautiful old boutiques passage just off the grand boulevard which have a lovely mix of shops and fabulous ambience.  There is even a hotel or two which access straight on to it. Minutes walk round the corner from Bouillon chartier as well
Stumbled upon this area by accident. We enjoyed wandering through the stores along the alleyway. Very cool!
A cute passage with nice little shops, ideal place to shop for gifts and decorations.

From the gardens of the Palais Royal begins the Gallerie Vivienne, then the Passage des Panoramas, then the Passage Jouffroy and finally the Passage Verdeau. Exiting the Passage des Panoramas into the noise and traffic of the Boulevard Monmartre, one of the beautiful boulevards that designed by Baron Haussmann in 1860, you will see Passage Jouffroy across the street. Passage Jouffoy was built in 1846 and stood out for its fine boutiques and iconic shops with their wonderfully tuned, wooden toys. There is also the Grevin Museum of wax figures, the French equivalent of Britain's Tussauds. The entrance to the museum is not inside the gallery but on Boulevard Monmarte, a few steps away from the entrance of the gallery. However, the exit of the museum is inside the Passage, as is the museum shop. At the end of the Passage is the historic H√¥tel Chopin Paris, a well-known downtown hotel named after the great Polish composer Fr√©d√©ric Fran√ßois Chopin, who spent much of his life in Paris.
Super adorable Parisian passage with off-the-wall little shops. Very hip vibe overall.
Nice interior street to visit with amazing stores
Paris vibe from the corner. You can find beauty in almost everything
Lovely typical parisian passage with entrance to Gr√©vin museum
Wow, retro closes, museum, galleries and M&S. Great

An interesting covered passageway of shops. The architecture brings a historical, vintage feel, while most of the shops are on the more modern side. We came around Christmas, so not all of the shops were open, but it was still a cool place to visit, especially on a cold day when you want to be inside.
This passage is the most premium elegant passage I've seen in Paris so far. That bookstore.. wow....

Still with it's original 19th century glass ceilings, chipped floor tiles and huge  clock above the entry arcade, walking through this passage is like stepping back in time. Best place to avoid hordes of tourists. Here you can browse leisurely through art shops, old school toy stores, and interesting hobby shops.Our lunch at Le Valentin (which is actually best known for its great selection of tea and matching pastries) was a real charming experience.

This is one of the different and special area to visit in Paris . Something between modern and historical. Several artistic shops and museum and hotel in the middle . Walk through Montmartre blvd and continue it to the others passage in front of it. You will find several nice and antique paintings .
Other side tourist and parisien must see in paris

Lovely place, beautiful art moderne architecture, lots of cozy shops where you can buy old books, crystals, but also fancy leather notebooks and other parisien souvenirs. Lots of caf√©s and a good tea spot with delicious sweet treats. There are around other galleries, like the Vivienne one. You can visit all of them in an afternoon!

Intimate indoor path lined by boutique shops, small cafes, and antique dealers. It's worth walking through if you're on the way to another location, and is more Parisian than the surrounding streets - but don't go out of your way to visit.
A beautiful part of Paris' trade history.
